de.esoco.process.ui.layout

Class UiFlexLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.process.ui.UiElement<E>
      • de.esoco.process.ui.UiLayoutElement<UiLayout>
        • de.esoco.process.ui.UiLayout
          • de.esoco.process.ui.layout.UiFlexLayout

  • public class UiFlexLayout
extends UiLayout
    Places components in a horizontal or vertical flow that can be flexibly controlled by the properties defined by the CSS Flexbox layout.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign
      Enumeration of the component alignments in a CSS Flexbox layout.
      class  UiFlexLayout.FlexCell
      A UiLayout#Cell subclass that provides additional access methods for single Flexbox layout elements.
      static class  UiFlexLayout.FlexWrap
      Enumeration of the wrapping options in a CSS Flexbox layout.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class de.esoco.process.ui.UiLayout

        UiLayout.Cell, UiLayout.ChildElement<E extends UiLayout.ChildElement<E>>, UiLayout.Column, UiLayout.Row, UiLayout.StructureElement<E extends UiLayout.StructureElement<E>>

        eDirection - The direction of the layout
        bReverse - TRUE to reverse the flow along the given direction

    • Method Detail

      • alignContent

        public UiFlexLayout alignContent(UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign eAlign)
        Sets the alignment of the layout elements along the axis perpendicular to the layout flow. The default value if not set is UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign.STRETCH. The alignment BASELINE is not supported for the content, only for alignItems(FlexAlign).
        Parameters:
        eAlign - The cross-axis alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • alignHorizontal

        public UiFlexLayout alignHorizontal(de.esoco.lib.property.Alignment eAlign)
        Sets the horizontal alignment of elements. Overridden to map on either justifyContent(FlexAlign) or alignContent(FlexAlign) depending on the layout direction. This methods should be preferred for better readability and because they support additional Flexbox alignments.
        Overrides:
        alignHorizontal in class UiLayoutElement<UiLayout>
        Parameters:
        eAlign - The horizontal alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • alignItems

        public UiFlexLayout alignItems(UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign eAlign)
        Sets the alignment of layout elements in their respective layout cell along the axis perpendicular to the layout flow. The default value if not set is UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign.STRETCH. This value only has an effect that differs from the value set on alignContent(FlexAlign) if wrapping is enabled through wrap(). If not this value takes precedence over the content alignment although that should not be relied upon.
        Parameters:
        eAlign - The cross-axis alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • alignVertical

        public UiFlexLayout alignVertical(de.esoco.lib.property.Alignment eAlignment)
        Sets the vertical alignment of elements. Overridden to map on either justifyContent(FlexAlign) or alignContent(FlexAlign) depending on the layout direction. This methods should be preferred for better readability and because they support additional Flexbox alignments.
        Overrides:
        alignVertical in class UiLayoutElement<UiLayout>
        Parameters:
        eAlignment - The horizontal alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • justifyContent

        public UiFlexLayout justifyContent(UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign eAlign)
        Sets the positioning of all layout elements along the axis of the layout flow. The default value if not set is UiFlexLayout.FlexAlign.START. The alignment values STRETCH and BASELINE are not supported for the main layout axis.
        Parameters:
        eAlign - The element alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • noWrap

        public UiFlexLayout noWrap()
        Enables wrapping for this layout.
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • wrap

        public UiFlexLayout wrap()
        Enables wrapping for this layout.
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • wrapReverve

        public UiFlexLayout wrapReverve()
        Enables wrapping for this layout.
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation
